5.3.1.3. DiamondÂ¶

File containing class and functions related to running diamond on metagenome sequences

Running the script as stand alone module While in the Autometa directory and with the conda environment activated, run:

python -m autometa.common.external.diamond <path/to/input/file.faa>
</path/to/diamond/formatted/database> </path/to/ncbi/prot.accession2taxid.gz>
</path/to/diamond/output/file> <blastp or blastx> --[options]

Inputs : Protein file (faa format)

Returns : A dictionary of Blastp hits, with key = qseqid and value = Diamond result

Usage and Command line options:

Usage: Retrieves blastp hits with provided input assembly [-h] [--evalue EVALUE] [--maxtargetseqs MAXTARGETSEQS]
                                                          [--cpus CPUS] [--tmpdir TMPDIR] [--tmpdir TMPDIR]
                                                          [--top-pct TOP_PCT] [--force] [--verbose] fasta database
                                                          acc2taxids outfile {blastp,blastx}

Positional arguments:
fasta                               </path/to/input/faa/file>
database                            </path/to/diamond/formatted/database>
acc2taxids                          </path/to/ncbi/prot.accession2taxid.gz>
outfile                             </path/to/diamond/output/file>
blast type {blastp,blastx}          [blastp]: protein -> protein or [blastx]: Nucleic acid -> protein

Optional arguments:
-h, --help                          show this help message and exit
--evalue EVALUE                     diamond evalue threshold
--maxtargetseqs MAXTARGETSEQS       max target sequences to retrieve per query
--cpus CPUS                         number of cpus to use
--tmpdir TMPDIR                     </path/to/tmp/directory>
--top-pct TOP_PCT                   top percentage of hits to retrieve
--force                             force overwrite of diamond output table
--verbose                           add verbosity

Functions

docstring for DiamondResult.

Class and functions related to running diamond on metagenome sequences

diamond.add_taxids(hits, database, verbose=True)Â¶

Translates accessions to taxid translations from prot.accession2taxid.gz

# TODO: Should maybe write a wrapper for this to run on all of the NCBI databases listed belowâ¦ Maybe this will help account for instances where the accession is not found due to suppression,deprecation,removal,etcâ¦

DiamondResults contain sseqids with non-redundant protein sequence database entries from: - GenPept - Swissprot - PIR - PDF - PDB - RefSeq

Parameters

  • hits (dict) â {qseqid: DiamondResult, â¦}

  • database (str) â </path/to/prot.accession2taxid.gz>

Returns

hits - {qseqid: DiamondResult, â¦} sseqids dicts updated with âtaxidâ key

Return type

dict

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError â prot.accession2taxid.gz database is required for translation taxid

  • DatabasesOutOfDateError â prot.accession2taxid.gz database and nr.dmnd are out of sync resulting in accessions that are no longer available (either due to being suppressed, deprecated or removed by NCBI). This must be resolved by updating both nr and prot.accession2taxid.gz and re-running diamond on the new nr.dmnd database. Alternatively, can try to find the exceptions in merged.dmp

# TODO: Replace file_length func for database file. (in this case 808,717,857 lines takes ~15 minutes simply to read each lineâ¦) This causes unnecessary slowdown. On download of the respective database. Line counts can be saved in config and replaced here for the file_length func. This will allow for only one read-through of the file, instead of two.

diamond.blast(fasta, database, outfpath, blast_type='blastp', evalue=1e-05, maxtargetseqs=200, cpus=0, tmpdir='.', force=False, verbose=False)Â¶

Performs diamond blastp search using fasta against diamond formatted database

Parameters

  • fasta (str) â </path/to/fasta/file>. May be amino acid or nucleotide sequences

  • database (str) â </path/to/diamond/formatted/database>.

  • outfpath (str) â </path/to/output/file>.

  • blast_type (str) â blastp if fasta consists of amino acids or blastx if nucleotides

  • evalue (float) â cutoff e-value to count hit as significant (the default is float(â1e-5â)).

  • maxtargetseqs (int) â max number of target sequences to retrieve per query by diamond (the default is 200).

  • cpus (int) â number of cpus to use (the default is 1).

  • tmpdir (type) â </path/to/temporary/directory> (the default is os.curdir).

  • force (boolean) â overwrite existing diamond results force (the default is False).

  • verbose (boolean) â log progress to terminal verbose (the default is False).

Returns

outfpath

Return type

str

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError â fasta file does not exist

  • ValueError â provided blast_type is not âblastpâ or âblastxâ

  • OSError â Diamond execution failed

diamond.parse(results, top_pct=0.9, verbose=False)Â¶

Retrieve diamond results from output table

Parameters

  • results (str) â </path/to/blastp/outfmt6/output/file>

  • top_pct (0 < float <= 1) â bitscore filter applied to each qseqid (the default is 0.9).

Returns

{qseqid: DiamondResult, â¦}

Return type

dict

Raises

  • FileNotFoundError â diamond results table does not exist

  • ValueError â top_pct value is not a float or not in range of 0 to 1
